intro: Bupleurum komarovianum, commonly known as Komarov's angelica, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It is often found in rocky or arid habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been studied for potential uses in traditional and modern herbal medicine.
